sources.title: The Vikings (1958) Kirk Douglas · Tony Curtis
sources.description: Kirk Douglas and Tony Curtis vie for Janet Leigh .   In the 8th and 9th centuries, the Vikings seek to conquer England. During one of their raids, Viking leader Ragnar ( Ernest Borgnine ) kills the king and rapes his wife. Nine months later, she gives birth to a son: Eric. The child is kidnapped and raised as a slave by the Vikings. Eric ( Tony Curtis ) hates Einar ( Kirk Douglas ), Ragnar's second son. Unaware that they are half-brothers, the two heroes simultaneously fall in love with the English Princess Morgana ( Janet Leigh ).   As in 1960's "Spartacus," lead actor Kirk Douglas also serves as producer. A timelessly impressive adventure!

sources.title: The Vikings (1958)
sources.description: The Vikings is a 1958 American epic historical fiction swashbuckling film It  follows the story of Viking Prince Einar and his half-brother Eric, a slave, who unknowingly compete for the love of Princess Morgana. Their conflict intensifies as Einar kidnaps Morgana, leading to a series of battles and revelations about their shared lineage and their father's fate.

metadata.Plot: Einar and Eric are two Viking half-brothers. The former is a great warrior whilst the other is an ex-slave, but neither knows the true identity of the other. When the throne of Northumbria in Britain becomes free for the taking, the two brothers compete against one another for the prize, but they have very different motives - both involving the princess Morgana, however.
metadata.Writer: Calder Willingham, Dale Wasserman, Edison Marshall
metadata.Actors: Kirk Douglas, Tony Curtis, Ernest Borgnine
